page.title: 01Elsenham Jam Factory
page.content: Elsenham Jam Factory was founded in 1890 by Sir Walter Gilbey when he planted local orchards. Since the re-building of the factory following the fire in 1969 the company has done remarkably well selling its produce to 35 countries. The USA is its main market but it also does well in Germany, France, Australia and Japan. Whilst some of the fruits for the preserves are grown locally (notably strawberries and damsons) many are imported from abroad; apricots and oranges from Spain; and cherries from Holland, for example. It is quite a small factory, with a growing reputation for quality foods, its products are now considered upmarket. It employs approximately 70 people, almost half of them women.
